game_description: Make yourself at home in one of the five metropolises torn straight out of the 90s You look at them and feel an irrepressible urge to destroy, don't you? Do not hesitate any longer, enter the game and do your work of destruction But be careful, people living in them will resist sending more and more military units at you KAIJU MONSTER VR FEATURES: Physics - Destroy urban environment based on physics. Resistance - Fight enemy military units (planes, tanks, rocket turrets, etc.). Armament - Shoot laser beams and anti-gravity weapon from your hands. Reverse card - Pick up and throw enemy units to cause havoc. Watch yourself - Manage your energy level and temperature by destroying buildings and water sources (water towers, ice cream trucks, etc.). Variety - Play in five themed cities with three difficulty levels each.

review_5: Video first impression review: https://youtu.be/4x62OkPdrf0 Kaiju Monster VR demo felt great. I took the form of a large Kaiju monster, smashing and wreaking havoc on buildings and army units with my own fists in virtual reality. I love the stylized low-poly city look (although I really felt like smashing things in a hyper-realistic one as well). I didn't find a way to climb buildings though, and as a big fan of the retro arcade game "Rampage", this is something I want to do as well. First impressions are very positive, and I really like games that take a different perspective, either making you huge or tiny. From what I read, there are a total of five themed cities with three difficulty levels in the final. I am enjoying the demo so far. I see myself continuing to smash things in VR and taking on the challenge.
